Package io.github.ai4ci.abm.inhost

package io.github.ai4ci.abm.inhost
In-host models for simulating viral infection dynamics within individuals.

The classes in this package implement different mathematical approaches to model the progression of viral infections and immune responses within a single host. These models simulate the discrete-time evolution of key compartments including virions, target cells (susceptible, exposed, infected, removed), and immune cells (dormant, priming, active).

Core Model Types

  • InHostStochasticState - A stochastic difference equation model that captures demographic and interaction noise using binomial and Poisson sampling
  • InHostMarkovState - A Markov chain model for simulating discrete state transitions in viral dynamics
  • InHostPhenomenologicalState - A phenomenological model that focuses on observed infection patterns rather than mechanistic details

Key Features

  • Convert continuous-time rate parameters to discrete-time probabilites using p = 1 - e^(-r) for consistent simulation
  • Support external inputs such as new virion exposure and immunization events
  • Track multiple infection waves and immune memory effects
  • Interface with agent-based models through shared state definitions

Usage Context

These in-host models are typically used within the broader agent-based simulation framework to represent infection progression at the individual level, informing transmission dynamics between agents in the population-level model.

  • Class
    Description
    InHostMarkovState
    A discrete-time Markov chain model of in-host disease and symptom progression.
    InHostMarkovState.DiseaseState
    The disease progression states in the Markov model.
    InHostMarkovState.InHostMarkovStateMachine
    Defines the transition probabilities for the Markov chain model of disease and symptom progression.
    InHostMarkovState.SymptomState
    The clinical symptom progression states.
    InHostModelState<CFG extends InHostConfiguration>
    Interface for in-host models that simulate viral dynamics, immune response, and disease progression over time within an individual.
    InHostPhenomenologicalState
    A phenomenological in-host model that tracks viral load and immune activity over time, supporting multiple exposures (e.g., reinfection or vaccination).
    InHostPhenomenologicalState.BiPhasicLogistic
    A biphasic logistic model for viral load or immune response dynamics.
    InHostPhenomenologicalState.ExposureModel
    Represents a single exposure event (infection or vaccination) that contributes to viral load and immune response.
    InHostStochasticState
    A stochastic difference equation model of in-host viral dynamics and immune response.
